question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate, expert responses. Be sure that any code you create is executable and can be properly displayed. Please help me implement this SVG image using code: a picture of a black and white picture of a sliding door.

checklist.title: Is the SVG sliding door structure accurately implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code correctly uses SVG elements to construct a sliding door structure, including door frames, door panels, tracks, and handles. Check if the geometric proportions are realistic and the structural relationships are logical. Score 0 if basic door structure is missing, 5 if only simple rectangles represent doors, and 10 if detailed architectural elements like frames, panels, tracks, and hardware are properly modeled with accurate proportions.

checklist.title: Is the black and white visual styling properly executed?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG implements proper black and white styling with appropriate use of grayscale values, stroke weights, and fill patterns. Check for consistent monochrome palette, proper contrast ratios, and effective use of shadows/highlights to create depth. Deduct 5 points if colors other than black, white, and gray are used. Deduct 3 points if contrast is insufficient for clear visibility. Full score requires sophisticated grayscale gradients and shading.

checklist.title: Does the sliding door demonstrate functional sliding mechanics?
checklist.description: Check whether the implementation includes interactive sliding functionality through CSS animations or JavaScript, with realistic door movement along tracks. Evaluate if the sliding motion follows proper physics (easing, momentum) and visual feedback. Score 0 if no sliding interaction exists, 5 if basic CSS transitions are present, and 10 if smooth, realistic sliding mechanics with proper track constraints and momentum are implemented.

checklist.title: Are architectural details and hardware components accurately represented?
checklist.description: Assess whether the code includes realistic architectural details such as door handles, lock mechanisms, track systems, frame joints, and panel divisions. Check if hardware elements are proportionally correct and positioned logically. Deduct 3 points for missing essential hardware components, 5 points if proportions are unrealistic, and 2 points for each misplaced architectural element. Full score requires comprehensive detailing.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid SVG parameters, browser compatibility issues, animation glitches, etc.) and provide graceful degradation. Code with strong robustness should effectively handle edge cases like viewport resizing, interaction conflicts, and rendering failures. Give 10 points if fully robust, 5 points if average robustness, and 0 points if no exception handling exists.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the visual experience (e.g., 1. Realistic shadow casting based on light source 2. Multiple door panels with synchronized movement 3. Interactive sound effects for sliding motion 4. Perspective transformation for 3D effect). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant SVG elements that don't contribute to the door visualization 2. Unnecessary animations or effects unrelated to sliding door functionality 3. Overly complex path definitions that could be simplified. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if core door visualization is interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review SVG code organization (such as proper grouping with <g> elements, reusable <defs> and symbols), clean markup structure, and maintainable CSS/JavaScript integration. Deduct 5 points if SVG structure is poorly organized or lacks semantic grouping; deduct 5 points if code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if inline styles are overused instead of CSS classes. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG design follows professional architectural illustration principles: 1) Consistent line weights and stroke styles 2) Proper use of negative space and composition balance 3) Clear visual hierarchy with appropriate scale relationships 4) Professional drafting standards for technical illustration. Deduct 3 points for each inconsistent visual element, 5 points for poor composition balance, and 5 points for unprofessional line work quality. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the sliding animations conform to realistic motion characteristics: 1) Smooth acceleration/deceleration curves 2) Proper timing functions (300-500ms for door sliding) 3) Visual continuity without jarring transitions 4) Responsive interaction feedback. Deduct 5 points for each choppy animation, 3 points for unrealistic motion physics, and 5 points for poor interaction responsiveness. The full score is 10 points.
